author: ACCESSWIRE
title: Revolutionizing the Internet: The Role of DePIN in Global Resource Management | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
KUALA LUMPUR, MALAYSIA / ACCESSWIRE / July 19, 2024 / In the evolving landscape of decentralized internet concepts, the frameworks established by early projects like Hyphanet and Tor are being significantly advanced by sophisticated blockchain-based models such as the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) and Arweave. Despite these strides, a major hurdle persists: the extensive physical infrastructure required to rival the robustness and speed of established internet service providers. This challenge has historically dampened the widespread adoption of decentralized models.
However, a revolution in global web utilization and support is closer than it appears. Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks (DePINs) are emerging as viable solutions, leveraging existing technologies and infrastructures to overcome the barriers that have previously hindered broader applications.
Today's Internet and the Rise of DePIN
Currently, the internet relies heavily on centralized servers maintained by major technology corporations. While this centralization facilitates certain economies of scale, it also concentrates control, raising issues from data privacy to systemic vulnerabilities. As we move into 2024, DePINs present an alternative architecture. These blockchain-based data management systems offer a contrasting model by enabling crowd-sourced infrastructure. DePIN stands out by providing comparable, if not superior, service through incentivization methods like cryptocurrency compensation.
A principal challenge for the decentralization of such systems has been the requirement for specific, costly hardware, which can discourage widespread participation and inadvertently benefit large-scale operations, leading to new forms of centralization within purportedly decentralized frameworks.
DePIN not only consolidates global hardware resources but also accelerates the development of next-generation AI-driven societies. By leveraging decentralized physical infrastructure networks, DePIN enables efficient distribution and utilization of computing resources worldwide. This optimization is pivotal in fostering an environment where artificial intelligence can evolve rapidly and inclusively, laying the groundwork for significant advancements in AI integration into human societal structures.
AeroNyx's Approach to DePIN
AeroNyx has positioned itself as a pioneer within this domain by utilizing DePIN to manage and tokenize essential computing resources such as GPUs, CPUs, bandwidth, and storage capacities. Through innovative integration of blockchain technologies like onion routing and data sharding, AeroNyx enhances security and privacy across its network. Onion routing obscures data paths, protecting user identities and decreasing surveillance risks, while data sharding distributes sensitive information across multiple nodes, increasing data integrity and reducing unauthorized access risks.
AeroNyx further bolsters its strategy by implementing advanced encryption technologies such as ECDSA, SECP256k1, ECDH, zero-knowledge proofs, and AES. These technologies create a robust, next-generation privacy network layer that complies with HTTP protocols, allowing for secure global transactions.
Moreover, AeroNyx has developed a Re-encryption staking network, enabling any user worldwide with privacy bandwidth needs to establish decentralized nodes using their own managed servers. Participants can stake various tokens to cover usage costs, promoting a flexible and economically viable model for decentralized participation.
AeroNyx has received strategic partnership support and investment from Waterdrip Capital, DePHY, and JrrCrypto. These partnerships enhance AeroNyx's capabilities and reach, leveraging combined expertise and resources to drive the development and adoption of DePIN technology.
The world's largest energy re-staking facility has been established on the Re-encryption staking network, providing global users with access to clean energy. This initiative leverages networks like TON and Solana, allowing users to participate and benefit from renewable energy resources. This strategic expansion not only enhances the network's capabilities but also aligns with global sustainability goals by integrating clean energy solutions into the blockchain infrastructure.
Looking Forward
The promise of DePINs lies in their potential to democratize access to computing resources, reducing the entry barriers that have traditionally favored large entities. With technologies like those developed by AeroNyx, it's possible to envision a future where global digital infrastructure is not only more robust and secure but also more equitable.
The infrastructure for such transformative change is already within our grasp. With continued technological refinement and increased adoption, we can soon realize a new era of internet functionality that supports broader, more inclusive participation. This evolution could fundamentally alter how we conceive of and interact with the digital world, making it a reality where anyone, anywhere, can contribute to and benefit from the internet's vast potential.

author: VNExplorer
title: La Corte Suprema de Justicia acusó formalmente al senador Guido Echeverri Piedrahita
text: Guido Echeverri. Cortes La Corte Suprema de Justicia acusó formalmente al senador Guido Echeverri Piedrahita El proceso se da por el delito de peculado culposo por decisiones que generaron un detrimento en Caldas cuando fue gobernador de ese departamento. Jesús Antonio Blanquicet En la mañana de este jueves 13 de junio, la Corte Suprema de Justicia acusó al exgobernador de Caldas y senador Guido Echeverri Piedrahíta por el presunto delito de peculado culposo. (Lea: Corte Constitucional pide al Consejo de Estado remitir sentencia de nulidad del magistrado del CNE Altus Alejandro Baquero) La acusación fue realizada por Sala Especial de Instrucción dentro de la investigación que lo señala de haber, presuntamente, generado detrimento al departamento con la participación de la Promotora Energética del Centro en una subasta del Cargo por Confiabilidad realizada el 28 de febrero de 2019 y organizada por la Comisión de Regulación de Energía y Gas (CREG), en el marco del proyecto hidroeléctrico Miel II. Para la fecha, Echeverri era el gobernador de ese departamento.

author: Marisol García Lugo
title: Disfruta de la Rosca de Reyes sin culpa - Periódico AM
text: [Consejos](https://www.am.com.mx/consejos)el Disfruta de la Rosca de Reyes sin culpa Comer rosca de Reyes no tiene por qué hacerte romper la dieta Si iniciaste dieta o régimen alimenticio junto con el Año Nuevo, o te sobrepasaste con las cenas de Navidad y fin de año, no te preocupes, no tienes que privarte de la Rosca de Reyes si optas por esta versión elaborada con masa madre que es muy nutritiva. Además de que te sorprenderá con su gran sabor, textura y combinación de frutas, te brindará múltiples beneficios a la salud. La masa madre es un tipo de fermento compuesto de harina y agua, que le aporta un sabor inigualable al pan, y los aromas que se generan en el proceso de elaboración ayudan a controlar la acidez del producto. Nutritiva y deliciosa, conoce sus beneficios 1- Mejora la digestión La masa madre contiene bacterias ácido-lácticas que actúan como probióticos y prebióticos, los cuales son buenos para la salud intestinal, pues hacen más fácil la digestión. 2.- Aporta vitaminas La composición de esta masa es tan compleja que aporta muchos nutrientes. Entre ellos las vitaminas B1 a B6, B12, E, entre otras. Además, tiene un increíble balance de proteínas y ácidos grasos. 3.- Contiene fibra Su preparación se realiza con levadura natural, por ello las bacterias que intervienen en su proceso de fermentación, ayudan a mantener un alto contenido de fibra. 4.- Proporciona minerales Las frutas, como el higo y la naranja, que se emplean en la decoración de la rosca, contienen minerales buenos para la salud; como el hierro, que es el encargado de transportar oxígeno a la sangre, y el potasio, que ayuda al buen funcionamiento del riñón. 5- Brinda energía La almendra fileteada que adorna la rosca aporta energía al organismo, además de hierro que ayuda a combatir la anemia. Mira también: [Consejos](https://www.am.com.mx/consejos)el Las 8AM Recibe gratis por email las 8 noticias esenciales de AM, antes de las 8:00 a.m.

author: feedloaderapi
title: NDP’s Jagmeet Singh says report shows ‘a number of MPs’ have helped foreign states
text:
OTTAWA – NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh says a recent spy watchdog report shows a “number of MPs” have knowingly provided help to foreign governments — behaviour he calls unethical or even illegal.
Singh said Thursday he is “more alarmed today” after reading an unredacted version of a report on foreign interference by the National Security and Intelligence Committee of Parliamentarians.
The intelligence watchdog, composed of MPs and senators, said in a public report last week that some parliamentarians are “semi-witting or witting” participants in the efforts of foreign states to meddle in Canadian politics.
New Democratic Party Leader Jagmeet Singh speaks in the Foyer of the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Wednesday, June 12, 2024. THE CANADIAN PRESS/ Patrick Doyle The blunt findings prompted a flurry of concern that members knowingly involved in interference might still be active in politics.
Singh told reporters that after seeing the full report, he is “more convinced than ever” of the watchdog’s public conclusions.
“In short, there are a number of MPs who have knowingly provided help to foreign governments, some to the detriment of Canada and Canadians,” Singh said.
“There are also politicians at all levels of government who have benefited from foreign interference. Some of this behaviour absolutely appears to be criminal and should be prosecuted.”
Singh said the report also stated that he had been a target of foreign interference.
But the NDP leader did not provide details about the number of MPs implicated in the report, their political affiliations or the nature of the alleged misdeeds.
Singh said previously that if the full report showed any New Democrat MP knowingly took part in meddling, he would remove them from caucus. He indicated Thursday he would not be taking such action.
Singh said other party leaders should look at the unredacted report and determine whether any of their caucus members must step away.
The Green Party’s Elizabeth May, who has also seen the full version, said this week it does not contain a “list of MPs who have shown disloyalty to Canada.”
May said she believes the small number of MPs named in the report did not knowingly set out to betray Canada.
“I am very comfortable sitting with my colleagues,” she said. “We will disagree on policy on many issues. But I am vastly relieved.”
May said one unnamed former MP accused in the report of proactively sharing privileged information with a foreign operative should be fully investigated by authorities.
But she was quick to add that the few named people in the unredacted report “may be compromised,” as they were “beneficiaries of foreign governments interfering in nomination contests.”
New Democratic Party Leader Jagmeet Singh speaks in the Foyer of the House of Commons about the NSICOP report, on Parliament Hill in Ottawa, on Thursday, June 13, 2024. THE CANADIAN PRESS/ Patrick Doyle The House of Commons voted overwhelmingly in favour of a Bloc Québécois motion this week to have an ongoing commission of inquiry delve into the intelligence watchdog’s findings about specific MPs.
Bloc Leader Yves-François Blanchet has also signalled a desire to be briefed on the complete watchdog report.
Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre has not taken steps to acquire the security clearance needed to read the full report.
Singh accused Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of failing to act on the report’s findings.
Winnipeg Free Press | Newsletter Business Weekly Monday mornings
The latest local business news and a lookahead to the coming week.
Sign up for Business Weekly Sign Up I agree to the Terms and Conditions, Cookie and Privacy Policies , and CASL agreement . He also condemned Poilievre for refusing to learn more about “very disturbing allegations” of foreign interference in Conservative leadership races.
“The fact that he doesn’t want to know and has been silent, I believe very firmly disqualifies him as a prospective leader of this country,” Singh said.
Liberal MP David McGuinty, who chairs the spy watchdog composed of parliamentarians, said Wednesday that national security and intelligence should not be a partisan issue.
He said party leaders could come together and “have an adult conversation” about how to deal with the issue within their own parties.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published June 13, 2024.
